info.description: API documentation for the Full Stack Template backend service
info.title: Full Stack Template API

get.description: Check if the server is running and healthy
Simple health/test endpoint that returns a greeting message

post.description: Register a new user account with email, name, and password. Creates a session in the database for immediate authentication. The returned JWT token is tied to an active session that can be invalidated on logout.

200.description: User registered successfully with JWT token and active session created

400.description: Validation Error - Invalid request body, params, or query

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict occurred

500.description: Internal Server Error - Unexpected server error

post.description: Login with email and password to receive JWT authentication token. Creates a new session in the database that ties the token to an active session. Each login creates a unique session that can be independently invalidated.

200.description: Login successful with JWT token and new session created

400.description: Validation Error - Invalid request body, params, or query

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token

500.description: Internal Server Error - Unexpected server error

post.description: Logout the authenticated user by deleting their session from the database. This immediately invalidates the JWT token - any subsequent requests using this token will fail authentication. Provides production-ready security without requiring Redis or token blacklist. The client should also clear the token from local storage.

200.description: Logout successful, session deleted from database, token immediately invalidated

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token

500.description: Internal Server Error - Unexpected server error

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token

500.description: Internal Server Error - Unexpected server error

get.description: Retrieve user information by ID. Users can only access their own data.

403.description: Forbidden - Insufficient permissions for this resource

404.description: Not Found - Requested resource does not exist

500.description: Internal Server Error - Unexpected server error
